data.message: What is the point?  I don't get the significance of this truck nor why I should venture out to see it.  Do you give out freebies or something?

replies.message: It's just their way of trying to make out that Christmas just isn't Christmas without having Coca Cola when infact it totally is Christmas no matter what
No offence why moan about it not interested don't bother other people enjoy it so stop being so bah humbug
If I wasn't interested I would not waste my time asking the question.  Who is bothering people who are enjoying it and who is being, "so bah humbug"?  The only person being negative here is you.

They give family photos mainly for the children as they love the trucks.
You get given a card and put the password online 48 hours after and a lovely pic to print and keep that was taken by coke staff. There is fake snow and carol singers etc.
Also they give a free can of pop.
My boys face was amazing he loves the truck

Thats almost like saying what is the point in christmas adverts e.g. john lewis or toys r us adverts, theyre fun cute and get people into the fun of christmas, kids love it and its a bit of harmless advertising
